meanings.definition: The act of compelling or forcing someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's compellations made the students complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The compellations of the law required everyone to wear a seatbelt while driving.
meanings.sent3: The compellations of the strict coach led the team to victory.
meanings.sent4: Her compellations to study harder were like a gentle push towards success.
meanings.sent5: The compellations of the urgent deadline spurred him into action.

meanings.definition: A name or title given to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The royal compellations of the ancient kings were grand and majestic.
meanings.sent2: She earned the compellation of 'Employee of the Month' for her hard work.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compellation of 'Champion' brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: The compellation 'Master Chef' suited his culinary skills perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The compellation 'Best Friend' meant the world to her.

meanings.definition: The act of calling or summoning someone.
meanings.sent1: The compellations from the stage prompted the actor to come forward.
meanings.sent2: His compellations for help were answered by a passing stranger.
meanings.sent3: The compellations to join the adventure were met with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The compellations of the wild called to him like a siren's song.
meanings.sent5: Her compellations to attend the party were impossible to resist.
